description: Verify that Level 2 'Shadow in the Inbox' can be started correctly with proper authentication and prerequisite checking
scenario: User starts Level 2 from the levels page after completing Level 1 to begin email security training
expected_results: Navigate to simulation page, initialize SimulatedPC with Level 2 data, and begin boot sequence
procedure:
1. Complete Level 1 to unlock Level 2
2. Log in as authenticated user
3. Navigate to /levels
4. Click 'Start Level' button on Level 2 card
5. Verify navigation to /levels/2/start
6. Check simulation page loads with correct level data
7. Confirm SimulatedPC initializes with Level 2 information

description: Verify complete end-to-end workflow for Level 2 from start to completion with email security skill development
scenario: User completes entire email security training gaining phishing detection and email analysis skills
expected_results: Complete workflow provides engaging cybersecurity education covering phishing detection, email analysis, and social engineering awareness
procedure:
1. Start Level 2 from levels page after completing Level 1
2. Experience simulation boot sequence and desktop initialization
3. Receive introduction dialogue explaining email security challenge
4. Launch email client application automatically
5. Navigate through email folders (Inbox and Spam)
6. Analyze diverse email types with progressive difficulty
7. Practice identifying legitimate emails (Phalanx Cyber Academy Welcome, Company Updates)
8. Learn to detect obvious phishing (Nigerian Prince scams)
9. Develop skills recognizing sophisticated attacks (Fake PayPal, Bank, Microsoft)
10. Master spear phishing identification techniques
11. Use 'Report Phishing' action for suspicious emails with confirmation
12. Use 'Mark as Legitimate' action for genuine communications
13. Receive real-time feedback on classification accuracy
14. Build expertise in identifying suspicious senders, urgent language, unexpected attachments
15. Learn to recognize requests for sensitive information and social engineering
16. Complete all email analysis challenges successfully
17. Trigger level completion dialogue and earn 150 XP in Email Security
18. Receive 'Email Security Expert' badge recognition
19. Call completion API to unlock Level 3 (Malware Mayhem)
20. Exit simulation through proper shutdown sequence
21. Return to levels page with updated progress and Level 3 unlocked
22. Verify comprehensive skill development in phishing detection, email analysis, and social engineering awareness essential for cybersecurity defense

description: Verify the email list interface displays emails correctly with proper metadata and status indicators
scenario: User views email list to select and analyze emails for phishing detection
expected_results: Email list shows sender, subject, timestamp, read status, and security indicators
procedure:
1. View email inbox
2. Verify each email shows sender address
3. Check subject lines are displayed clearly
4. Confirm timestamps show relative times (minutes/hours ago)
5. Verify read/unread status indicators
6. Check security status indicators for each email
7. Test email sorting by timestamp (newest first)

description: Verify email content renders correctly with proper HTML formatting and security
scenario: Email application displays email content with proper formatting while maintaining security
expected_results: Email content shows proper HTML rendering, images, and styling while preventing malicious code execution
procedure:
1. Open various email types (PayPal, Microsoft, Phalanx Cyber Academy)
2. Verify HTML content renders correctly
3. Check images display properly (PayPal logo, etc.)
4. Confirm styling preserves email appearance
5. Verify links are rendered but safe
6. Check email headers display correctly
7. Test content security prevents malicious execution

description: Verify proper error handling when Level 2 simulation encounters issues
scenario: System handles various error conditions gracefully during email security training
expected_results: Appropriate error messages display and recovery options are provided
procedure:
1. Test with invalid level data
2. Simulate email application launch failure
3. Test email loading errors
4. Verify network error handling for API calls
5. Check error display in email interface
6. Test 'Return to Levels' button functionality
7. Verify error logging and user feedback
